Ha trabajado duramente para poder mantener su negocio activo y así poder llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su prioridad es su familia y es por ella que día a día se levanta muy temprano para tener listo el delicioso pan a la hora de que los clientes soliciten. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de la materia prima necesaria al por mayor (harina, huevos, azúcar, leche, colorantes, manteca, etc.) con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar su nivel de ventas como su nivel de ingresos de tal forma que lo lleven a alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 48 years old. He lives in his own house together with his family group which is made up of his wife and his five children. Three of them are working. He makes a living making and selling sweet French pastries. He has been devoted to this business for many years and it is his main source of income. He has worked hard in order to keep his business active and be able to put the daily bread and butter on the table at home.

His priority is his family and for this reason he gets up very early in order to have the delicious pastries ready for when his customers want them. He has decided to invest in his business. This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying necessary basic supplies wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.). His aim is to satisfy a greater demand in order to improve his sales and, in turn, his income. This would allow him to fulfil his biggest dream which is to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.

loans.name: Suru Lere Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SURU LERE est composé de cinq personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mouffouliatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mouffouliatou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Mouffouliatou est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Mouffouliatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Mouffouliatou mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d'année, la vente d'acajou par le système de livraison. Mouffouliatou achète les noix d'acajou qu'elle transforme, dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mouffouliatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SURU LERE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The SURU LERE group consists of five people living in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group has sought financial assistance from ALIDé to raise the level of their activity. The representative of the group, named Mouffouliatou, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Mouffouliatou left school at secondary level. She is 54 years old and is married to Christopher. The couple has three children all attending school. Mouffouliatou lives with her ​​husband and children. The various household expenses are managed jointly by the couple.

To achieve this, Mouffouliatou has been running a business for the past thirty years, selling cashew nuts through the distribution system. Mouffouliatou buys cashews for processing at a market in Benin. This activity allows her to contribute without much difficulty in supporting her family.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Mouffouliatou is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with other SURU LERE group members. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: buy cashew nuts

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es: Francisca Elizabeth de 37 años de edad, habita junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias, accesorios y minutas. Es una mujer increíble, con mucha energía y creatividad en su negocio. La ubicación del negocio es bien estratégica ya que se encuentra sobre la calle principal de la zona donde ella habita. Tiene varios clientes que la prefieren por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, amable y creativa. Su negocio es muy atractivo gracias a la diversidad de productos que posee. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su tienda, por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de productos especialmente ropa, sandalias y accesorios que son los más vendidos, de tal forma de que los clientes se sientan atraídos y pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Espera lograr resultados positivos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She makes a living selling clothes, sandals, accessories and old clothes. She is an incredible woman, with a lot of energy and creativity in her business. Her business is strategically located, as it is on a main street in the area where she lives. She has various customers who prefer her as she is hard working, responsible, friendly and creative.

Her business is very attractive thanks to the great variety of products she has. She has made the decision to invest in her shop. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a variety of products, especially clothing, sandals and accessories, as they are what most sells. This way her customers will be attracted and she can cover a higher demand. She hopes to achieve positive results which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals and accessories.

loans.name: Naun Efraín

texts.es: Naun Efraín de 28 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 35 años y sus dos hijos de 16 y 5 años. Él se dedica al comercio de tienda en la cual ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio por lo que ya cuanta con algunos clientes fijos los cuales dan excelentes referencias. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que día a día piensa en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y es la única forma por la cual podría mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos al por mayor como: huevos, arroz, frijoles, pan, aceite, macarrones, churros, galletas, dulces, bebidas, etc. Confía plenamente en Dios y en su trabajo de que los resultados serán favorables y logrará su sueño.
texts.en:
Naun Efraín is 28 years old and he lives in his won house with his family group which is made up of his 35 year old wife and their two children aged 16 and 5. He makes a living managing his store where he offers a variety of staple needs products. He has six years experience in this business and has some regular customers who give excellent references. 

His biggest dream is to improve his and his family's quality of life. Day by day, he thinks of ways to make his business grow as it is his main source of income and this is the only way he could improve his and his family's living conditions. Because of this he has made the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business buying wholesale products, such as: eggs, rice, beans. bread, oil, pasta, churros, biscuits, sweets, drinks, etc. He fully trusts in God and that his work will produce favourable results in order to fulfil his dream.

loans.use: to buy: eggs, rice, beans, bread, oil, pasta, churros, biscuits, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Santa Luisa Group

texts.es:
Santa Luisa es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la cuidad de Curuguaty, ellas son mujeres humildes, que se dedican a actividades de campo. Ellas vieron en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso y ayuda para ellas. El objetivo de ellas al formar el grupo es el de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras, para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante.
Patricia es miembro del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas, comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues siempre debe de estar pendiente de los animales para que no les falte nada. Su mea es poder tener una gran variedad de animales y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de cerdos, los cuales va a cría y luego vender. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Santa Luisa is a group formed by 11 women from the city of Curuguaty. They are humble women who make a living in farming activities. They saw the program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity to progress and receive help. Their objective on forming the group is to work together and help each other mutually in order to get ahead.

Patricia is a member of the group and she tells us that she makes a living raising and selling animals such as pigs and chickens. She mentions that her work is very self sacrificing as she must always keep an eye on the animals and make sure they don't need anything. Her goal is to be able to have a greater variety of animals and in this way continue helping her family with the household expenses.

She came to the Fundación and to Kiva to buy pigs, which she will raise and later sell. She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Chaco Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras Chaco Poty actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo y comentan que se unieron con le esperanza de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Su meta es poder ayudar a sus familias y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Maria se dedica a la venta de bebidas y cuenta que le va muy bien, pues ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad de productos. Comenta que se inicio con un negocio muy pequeño, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado ir progresando y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones. Quiere seguir creciendo, y es en vista a ese sueño que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, vinos, whiskys, y demás variedades.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank of enterprising women 'Chaco Poty' is currently in their first loan cycle. They comment that they came together with the hope of getting ahead by means of joint work between them Their goal is to be able to help their families and give them a better life style.

Maria makes a living selling drinks and she tell us that it is going very well for her. She has a good clientèle as she always has a good variety of products. She mentions that she started with a very small business and that, thanks to her hard work, she has progressed and improved her conditions. She would like to continue growing and in view of this she is requesting a loan to buy drinks in general, such as sodas, wines, whiskeys and other varieties.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and she knows that it will help her greatly to continue growing as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy various drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil, tiene 32 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza, es madre de 3 hijos, esta muy satisfecha con la ayuda que ha recibido sobre todo cuando tuvo problemas con su trabajo, no le pagaron por 3 meses en una entidad publica, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo solventar a su familia durante ese tiempo, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener una buena relación familiar, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Dos Mil communal bank. She is 32 years old and has been a member of Finca Perú for four years. She makes a living selling beauty products. She is the mother of three children. 

She is very satisfied with the help she has received, especially when she had problems with her work. She wasn't paid for three months in a public business. Thanks to the loans she received she was able to maintain her family during this time. The training sessions helped her to be able to have a good family relationship. She will use this loan to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for education services for her children.

loans.name: Claudio Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Claudio; El socio tiene39 años de edad; el socio es soltero, el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio tiene un galpon que es un espacio especial para criar cuyes, el socio a aprendido todo sobre la crianza, alimentacion, reproduccion, gestacion de estos animales, el socio esta ampliando poco a poco su espacio y desea en esta ocasion invertir el prestamo en la compra de 200 cuyes para implementar su negocio.


El socio agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", which is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

His name is Claudio, he is 39, single and has a son.  He raises guinea pigs for a living in a special shed he has for this purpose, and has learned all about the care, feeding, reproduction, and gestation of these animals.  He is now expanding the shed little by little and plans to use the loan to buy 200 guinea pigs for the business.

The member is grateful for this loan opportunity which will allow him to invest in his business and grow economically.

loans.use: To fix up his shed and buy 200 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Leonor De Los Santos

texts.es: Leonor de 43 años de edad, es soltera, trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeras en el centro de salud de El Papayal desde hace 26 años. Esta solicitando  su 11vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda embaldosandola y asi brindar mayor comodidad  a su familia. Es importante mencionar que Leonor se caracteriza por ser una persona muy resposable con sus compromisos.
texts.en: Leonor, 43, is single and has worked as a nurses' aid at the health center in El Papayal for 26 years.  She is requesting her eleventh loan in order to renovate her house with tile to make it more comfortable for her family.  It is important to mention that Leonor is known for being a very responsible person with her commitments.

loans.use: To tile the house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 39 años, es madre de 2 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, Victoria tiene una Botica, en el tiempo que esta en Finca aprendió mucho gracias a las capacitaciones, le han ayudado a saber invertir en su negocio, cada vez que viene se distrae de todas sus preocupaciones, siente que todo este tiempo ha podido aumentar su negocio y se ha podido comprar una fotocopiadora para poder implementar en la Botica, ya que también compro útiles de escritorio. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en comprar regalos para la Botica.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 39 years old and is the mother of two children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for the last five years. Victoria has a shop. 

In the time she has been with the MFI she has learnt a lot thanks to the training sessions. They have helped her to know how to invest in her business. Every time she comes she forgets all her worries. She feels that all this time she has been able to extend her business; she has bought a photocopier to use in her shop, and she has also bought stationery items. She is requesting this loan to buy gifts to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy various gifts to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 36 años, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, es madre de 3 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, a podido aprender acerca de la puntualidad, la responsabilidad, las capacitaciones le ayudaron con la crianza de sus hijos, y como administrar mejor su negocio, en su vida personal esta mucho mejor, da gracias porque le pudieron ayudar y le brindaron los préstamos que le ayudaron a tener mas capital, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 36 years old and is the owner of a grocery shop. She is the mother of three children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for the last four years. 

She has learnt about punctuality and responsibility. The training sessions have helped her in how to raise her children and how to better manage her business. Her personal life is much better now. She is thankful for the help provided by means of the loans which helped her have more capital. The loan she is now requesting will be used to invest in buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen María, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, antes de entrar en Finca no trabajaba, una amiga la invitó, desde la fecha hace 10 años aproximadamente esta trabajando, nunca se retiró de su banquito, siempre trato de ser muy puntual, la responsabilidad, la honestidad y la caridad la aprendió en las capacitaciones que ha recibido, ha progresado mucho, pudo comprarse una chacra, trabaja junto a su esposo, se esfuerzan para poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación, ella se dedica a la venta de cereales, pero también vende comida los domingos, el préstamo que solicitan lo invertirá en al compra de cereales y abarrotes de primera necesidad para poder cocinar.
texts.en: Olga is a member of the communal bank "Virgen María".  She is 39 years old and the mother of four children.  Before joining Finca she did not work, but she was invited by a friend approximately ten years ago and has been working ever since.  She has never quit coming to the bank and has always been very punctual, responsible, honest and charitable, as learned through the training she has received.  She has progressed well and bought a patch of land which she farms with her husband.  They work hard to give their children a good education.  She sells cereals, and food on Sundays.  The loan will be used to buy cereals and basic groceries to cook.

loans.use: To buy cereals and groceries.

loans.name: Mabel Isabel

texts.es: La señora Mabel se dedica a la venta de zapatos,  vive en su casa propia situada en Villa Israel, zona periurbana de la ciudad, trabaja vendiendo zapatos desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja como contratista en construcción, pero trabaja en la frontera, ella esta al cuidando de sus tres hijos sola aunque su esposo envía dinero para los gastos del hogar, los cuales están en colegio y el ultimo es bebe  aun, trabaja le va muy bien en su actividad, por este motivo solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados al por mayor para surtir su mercadería, con el tiempo  esta pensando tener su propia tienda para la venta de sus mercadería, la Sra. Mabel es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Mabel sells shoes for a living.  She lives in her own house in Villa Israel, an outlying area of the city.  For two years she has been selling shoes.  Her husband works as a building contractor but works along the border.  She takes care of their three children alone although her husband sends her money for household expenses.  Her children are in school except for the youngest who is still a baby.  Since work is going very well she has decided to request a loan to buy shoes wholesale to restock her stall.  In the future she would like to open her own shoe store.  Mabel is a very hard-working woman who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 52 años, es dueña de un restaurante y vende ropa de Bebe en una galería, recuerda que empezó en uno de los primeros Banquitos de Finca Perú, recuerda que ella no trabajaba solo era ama de casa, al entrar a Finca empezó a trabajar, ahora esta muy satisfecha con todo lo que ha podido lograr, y todo gracias a las capacitaciones y la entrega de nuestra querida Morenita, ella con sus consejos le ha ayudado a que pueda tomar la decisión de ser autosuficiente. Pudo realizar sus sueños como construir su casa, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para bebe.
texts.en:
Celedonia is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 52 years old. She is the owner of a restaurant and sells baby clothes in a store. She remembers that she started in one of the first branches of Finca Perú. She remembers that she didn't work at the time; she was a housewife. On joining Finca, she started to work. Now she is very satisfied with all that she has been able to achieve. 

She gives thanks to the training sessions and the dedication of our dear Morenita. With her advice she helped Celedonia to make the decision to become self sufficient. She could fulfil her dreams and build her own house. With this loan she will invest in buying baby clothes.

loans.use: to buy a variety of baby clothes.

loans.name: Adan Renan

texts.es: Adan es socio del Banco Comunal Virgen María, tiene 31 años, es dueño de una Botica, y padre de 2 hijos, es casado, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, él antes tenía un Bar, ahora el esta muy bien porque aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones, su vida familiar a mejorado mucho, entonces trabajando mucho pudo tener su Botica, su sueño es tener una cadena de Boticas y ser un empresario próspero. Finca Perú es una Asociación que ayuda a los que desean trabajar y progresar, valora mucho todo lo que hacen por él. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en:
Adan is a member of the Virgen María communal bank. He is 31 years old. He is the owner of a shop and father of two children. He is married and has been a member of Finca Perú for five years. In the past he had a bar. 

Now he is very well because he has learnt a lot with the training sessions. His family life has improved greatly. Working hard he was able to have his shop. His dream is to have a chain of shops and to be a prosperous businessman. Finca Perú is an association which helps those who want to work and progress. He values everything they have done for him. He will invest this loan in buying medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Melina Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cosmeticos como perfumes,cremas,lapiz labiales entre otros productos,la socia vende en forma independiente llevando sus productos a diferentes lugares como instituciones o al publico en general, la socia tambien se sigue dedicando a la administracion de un hotel,por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cosmeticos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, lápiz labial. perfumes y deliniadores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues selling cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, lipstick and other products.  She works independently and sells her goods at different places such as institutions or directly to the general public.  She also works in administration for a hotel.  Through her jobs she is able to provide for her children.  Her goal is to have her own cosmetic shop.  She is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as creams, lipstick, perfumes and lip pencils.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as creams, lipstick, perfumes and lip pencils.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de quarante cinq ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a quatre enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits maraîchers  pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter intrants agricoles. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 45-year-old woman.  She is married to a mechanic and has four children.
Ablavi has been working as a reseller since 2007.  She sells gardening produce to customers  who come from all walks of life.  She buys her products at the Grand Market in Lomé and works alone.  At this time, her major challenge is that she cannot meet all of her customers' demand.  Ablavi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy agricultural products.  She wants to reinvest in her activity, and in the coming years, to turn it into a larger business. She says that with the profits, she plans to provide a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy market garden produce.

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es: El Sr. Ysmael vive en casa de sus padres en la zona el Dorado, es soltero y hace un año que se dedica a la elaboración de pan con la colaboración de sus padres, actualmente tiene su propio capital donde ya es independiente, el crédito que se le otorgo es para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar por quintal para al elaboración de pan ya que tiene mucha clientela. El sr. Ysmael coloca sus panes en las tiendas por su barrio y otros lugares que con el tiempo se esta haciendo conocer y así de esta manera entregar sus productos.   El sr. quedo muy agradecido por oportunidad y confianza que se le brindo al otorgarle dicho crédito ya que le ayudan a crecer en su negocio e incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ysmael lives in his parents' house in the area of Dorado. He is single and works making bread with his parents. Right now, he has his own capital and is independent. He was given the loan to buy flour, lard, and sugar by the sack to make the bread, since he has a lot of customers. Ysmael places his bread in neighborhood stores and in other places. Over time, he is becoming known and  able to distribute his products. He is very grateful for the opportunity and trust given to him with the loan since it helps him grow in his business and increase his working capital and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan  dedicado al comercio de accesorios de ferretería esto en la feria de Quillacollo que por cierto solo son tres días a la semana una vez concluido la jornada el debe de recoger su mercadería para volver a traer la siguiente feria y esa es la rutina del Sr. Juan para poder comercializar sus productos y así alimentar, vestir a toda su familia, el corre con todos los gastos del hogar. El sueña con poder conformar su propia ferretería  estable alquilar un lugar y ofrecer ahí sus productos, con el dinero del crédito el Sr. Juan Comprara Carretillas para surtir mas su puesto ya que le hacen falta estos productos ya que con la anterior compra de carretillas le fue muy bien y los clientes le piden mas carretillas, el Sr. Juan es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan sells hardware accessories in the Quillacollo fair. It's three days a week and once he finishes his work he must pick up his merchandise to bring it to the next fair. This is Juan's routine to sell his products and thus feed and clothe his whole family, since he pays all the household expenses. He dreams of being able to open his own stable hardware store, renting a place and offering his products there. With the money from the loan, Juan will buy wheelbarrows to stock his place more. He needs these products, since when he bought them previously it went very well for him and his customers are asking him for more wheelbarrows. Juan is a responsible and hardworking person who is thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 29 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child. 
Laura has a sausage-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business. 
Laura has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Laura hopes to gain big capital from her business to help her husband with their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and only one school-aged child. He’s looking to support his family and pay his child’s educational fees. Khaled has owned a stone quarry/factory since 2007. In parallel, he has been working to perform needed maintenance on apartments on request. Today, he’s asking to make a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional materials for his business, such as stone, metal, cement, and many others. He notes that this will develop his business and return to him in higher earnings. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for his business, such as stone, metal, cement, and many others.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 63 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with 4 children. 

Romulo is a Barangay Official and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of service. He has  requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to use for his house repairs and renovation.

Romulo has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.

loans.use: to repair and renovate his house

loans.name: Abdon

texts.es: El señor Abdón es un cliente nuevo de emprender es su primer ciclo que trabajara con nosotros. El cliente se dedica a la elaboración de tostado de fideo, trigo y maíz. Es un emprendimiento que inicio hace 14 años juntamente con su esposa Rosmary la cual se encarga de la comercialización del producto de esta manera ambos trabajan para sustentar su familia, tiene 4 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, el domicilio donde viven es propio, ahí también se encuentra su taller de trabajo, ellos viven en la zona de Sivingani ubicado al sud de la ciudad, el crédito que fue otorgado es capital de trabajo para la compra de fideo, maíz, trigo, azúcar que necesitan para incrementar su producción, están muy agradecidos por la confianza brindada en la fotografía el sr. se encuentra en su taller con sus equipos de tostado.
texts.en: Abdón is a new client of Emprender and this is his first loan cycle with us.  His business is making toasted noodles, wheat and corn.  He started this business 14 years ago together with his wife Rosmary who takes care of selling the product.  In this way they both work to support their family.  They have four children who are in school.  They own their own home and this is also where their workshop is located.  They live in Sivangani area, in the south of the city.  The loan that Abdón has been given will be used as working capital to buy noodles, corn, wheat and sugar which they need to increase their production.  They are very grateful for the trust that has been placed in them.  The borrower appears in the photo in his workshop, together with his roasting equipment.

loans.use: to buy supplies (noodles, corn, wheat)

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent has worked in the transport industry in Nakuru town for the last five years. He is 29 years old and married to Hyline.  The couple has four children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy a new motorcycle. 

In the future, Vincent hopes to buy a pickup truck that he will use to transport goods to and from the market

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Salah

texts.en: Salah is a 34-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and three children. He was working really hard to be able to cover his heavy expenses and satisfy his family's needs. He has been working in car trading for the past four years, and he is really satisfied with what he has attained so far. In parallel, he has been working at a local company since 2006. Today, he’s looking to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new car for his business.  In that way, he will be able to continue his job properly and therefore increase his sales. In the future, he plans to open his own car showroom.

loans.use: to purchase a new car for his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ay

texts.en:
Ay is a humble farmer as well as a good housewife to her family, living in Dongkor commune. She is now 44 years old and has become a mother of 2 school-age children. The main source of her income is generated by her husband who is a construction laborer earning approximately $5.00 per day. 

Ay now wants to acquire some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase a pump and fertilizers to put in the soil. This is her second loan cycle. Ay is confident that she can pay her loan back to our lenders because she has already paid off the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase a pump and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ariel Francisco

texts.es: Ariel de 26 años de edad es casado, trabaja para cla Alcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de maquinaria desde hace 4 años. Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de construir su cuarto para contar con mayor privacidad en casa de su mamà. Ariel se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador y espera en el futuro poder tener su propia vivienda para darle a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: 26-year-old Ariel is married and has been working for Juigalpa Council as a machinery operator for four years.  He is requesting his second loan to build a room so that he can have more privacy in his mom's house.  Ariel is noted as being very hard-working and he hopes, in the future, to own his own home so that he can provide his family with better conditions.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.ru: Мушараф женщина 32 лет, замужем, мать троих детей. Она торгует на большом рынке, хозяйственными средствами. За товаром ездит раз в месяц в Истаравшан и закупает товар у фирм. Она решила в кредит вылечить свои зубы. Из-за небольшого дохода семьи она никак не может посетить стоматолога. Её муж работает строителем, поэтому из-за не сезонности он сейчас временно не работает, но в весенне-летний сезон будет из своих доходов помогать жене в погашении.
texts.en: Musharaf is a 32-year-old married woman.  She is a mother of three children.  Musharaf sells consumer goods at the central market.  She goes to the city of Istaravshan once a month to buy goods from the firms.  Masharaf would like to receive a loan to finally get her teeth fixed.  Her low-income family cannot afford dental care.  Masharaf's husband is a construction worker.  His job is seasonal, and he is temporarily out of work.  He will start working again in spring and summertime and will help his wife to repay the loan.

loans.use: to get her teeth fixed

loans.name: Mukimchon

texts.ru: Мукимчон, молодой человек, женат, имеет троих детей. Сам вырос и живёт в сельской местности, поэтому с детства любит заниматься дехканским хозяйством и откормом скота. Мукимчон имеет землю и выращивает арахис, и продаёт оптовикам. Но его основной доход идёт от продажи скота. Он хочет, пока скот дешёвый на рынке, купить несколько голов скота и корма для них.Его жена занимается воспитанием детей и домашним хозяйством. На снимке Мукимчон в день выдачи.
texts.en: Mukimchon is a young married man with three children who lives in the countryside. He was raised in the countryside, that is why he loved living on a dekhan farm and fattening cattle from an early age. Mukimchon owns a land plot. He grows peanuts and sells them to wholesalers.  However, the biggest part of his income comes from selling the cattle. Mukimchon would like to buy a few heads of cattle and some feed for them while the market prices are low. His wife takes care of their children and the household. Mukimchon is pictured on the loan disbursement day.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelda

texts.es: La señora Nelda actualmente vive por la zona de los chacos, actualmente la clienta se dedica a la administración de su tienda de vidriería y trabajos en aluminio, su negocio se encuentra ubicado por la zona donde se encuentra su vivienda así de esta manera le queda muy cerca para atender su negocio. La señora se dedica a esta actividad desde hace más de 5 años teniendo buenos ingresos por el servicio, con el dinero del crédito comprara vidrios templados para surtir su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos en su vidriería. La  Sra. Nelda agradeció a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y también agradeció por la rapidez con la que se la atendió.
texts.en: Nelda lives in Los Chacos and currently runs a store where she sells products made from glass and aluminum.  Her business is located in the area where she lives which means its very close for her to go and work in.  She has been in this business for more than 5 years and earns good income.  She will use her loan money to buy tempered glass with which to stock her business, so that she can offer a variety of products in her store.  Nelda thanked the institution for the opportunity they provided and also thanked them for the speed with which they served her.

loans.use: to buy tempered glass

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years old and married to Musa, who works as a casual laborer to contribute to the family income. They have one child, aged four months. Caroline has been running her business for a period of about one year, with a monthly income of about KES 7,000.

She is taking out a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, to buy stock of plastic utensils to sell in her retail shop. She hopes to grow her business and give her child a quality education.

loans.use: To buy stock of plastic utensils for sale.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents. He’s the main source of income for his parents and they really depend on him. He has been working as a school bus driver since 2006 and has his loyal customers. In parallel, he has been working as a teacher at a local school since 2000. Today, he needs to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew the seats of his bus, as well as its engine, otherwise he may lose his loyal and trusting customers. This Kiva loan will allow him transport children safely. In the future, he plans to focus on one job to better support his family.

loans.use: to renew his bus’s seats as well as its engine

loans.name: Gisela Maria

texts.es: Gisela de 42 años vive en Barranquilla con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3  y 5 años. Ella tiene un creativo negocio a través del cual ofrece el servicio de limpieza de tapetes, alfombras, muebles para sala y comedor, actividad que desempeñó desde el año 2006, pues antes trabajó durante 10 años en empresas de la ciudad. Aunque ella es psicóloga de profesión, cuando conoció la actividad en la cual se desempeña  a través de su suegra,  en la ciudad de Medellín, se entusiasmó e inició con mucho entusiasmo que aun no ha perdido. Por eso ha consolidado su negocio en la ciudad de Barranquilla y ha invertido en su promoción con volantes avisos clasificados en periódicos y directorios telefónicos, publicidad móvil etc. La mayoría de sus clientes son hogares que requieren el servicio de limpieza y tapizado de sus juegos de sala, comedor, cortinas, alfombras y tapetes. En su negocio cuenta con la ayuda de un operario, quien maneja la maquina lava traperos y que deja los muebles limpios, desmanchados y secos en el mismo día, lo cual gusta mucho a su clientela. Con su gran visión de empresa, Gisela ha participado en ferias de limpieza que organizan almacenes de cadenas y  grandes superficies constructoras de la ciudad. El préstamo lo invertirá en insumos y mano de obra para atender clientes que cancelan 30 días después del servicio. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local abierto al público y disponer de un vehiculó para el transporte de su maquinaria.
texts.en: 42-year-old Gisela lives in Barranquilla with her husband and her two children who are 3 and 5.  She has a creative business through which she offers a cleaning service for rugs and living room and dining room furniture.  She started this business in 2006.  Before that she worked for companies in the city for ten years.  Although she is a psychologist by profession, when she learned about this business, which she carries out through her mother-in-law in the city of Medellín, she became keen and started working with a lot of enthusiasm which she still hasn't lost.  She has grown and strengthened her business in the city of Barranquilla and has invested in marketing the business through leaflets, ads in newspapers and telephone directories, mobile ads, etc.  Most of her customers are households who need cleaning and upholstering services for their living room and dining room furniture, drapes and rugs.  Gisela has the help of one worker who handles the cleaning machine and leaves the furniture clean, unstained and dry the same day.  This is something her customers really like.  With her great business vision, Gisela has taken part in cleaning fairs organized by chain stores and large stores in the city.  She will invest her loan in buying supplies and hiring staff to collect from customers who pay 30 days after they have received this service.  Her goal for the future is to have her own premises open to the public and to have a vehicle in which she can transport her equipment.

loans.use: to invest in supplies and to hire staff to collect from customers who pay 30 days after they have received her service

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica, se dedica a la venta de libros y también vende frutas los fines de semana.
El crédito lo necesita para la construcción del cielo falso (o sea cubrir) del pasillo de su casa para dar seguridad a su familia.
Ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos, ellos viven en casa propia en la zona de las Lomas ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Angélica sells books, and on the week-ends she also sells fruit.

She needs the loan to build a ceiling (or to cover) the hall of her house in order to make the house more safe for her family.

She is single and has two children.  They live in the own house in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a ceiling (or to cover) the hall of her house in order to make the house more safe for her family.

loans.name: Inocencia Del Carmen

texts.es: Inocencia de 57años de edad es soltera, labora para la Aldea SOS como Responsable de Limpieza desde hace 18 años. Esta solicitando su 6to credito con el objetivo de continuar con su proyecto de construccion de tapia, pues con el credito anterior logro comprar materiales de construccion pero quedo pendiente levantar las paredes, desea hacer la tapia para darle mayor seguridad a su familia y evitar problemas con los vecinos que le tiran a su patio basura y otros desperdicios.
texts.en: Inocencia is 57 years old and single.  She has been working as a cleaning manager for an SOS children's village for 18 years.  She is requesting her sixth loan so that she can continue with her project of building a [perimeter] wall.  With her previous loan she managed to buy building supplies but she still needs the wall to be built.  She would like to build the wall so that she can provide her family with more security and avoid problems with the neighbors who throw garbage and other waste into her yard.

loans.use: to build a wall

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in South Sudan for one year.

Silvia is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions, beans and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions, beans and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and one child. He’s the only one responsible for his family and he wants to offer them a better future. 

Mohammad opened a fishery 10 years ago, and he’s satisfied with the results he has attained so far. His wife has also been working as a babysitter since 2009. 

Today, Mohammad’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renovate and enlarge his fishery. He says that this will allow him serve a wider range of people and increase his revenues. In the future, Mohammad plans to open his own seafood restaurant.

loans.use: to renovate and enlarge his fishery.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline, age 32, is married to David who contributes to the family income. She has one child, age 6. She has been selling clothing for a period of six years, earning an income of KES 16,000 a month. 

This is Pauline's third loan from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock of curtains for sale. She hopes to improve the living standards of her family and provide a quality education for her child.

loans.use: To buy more stock of curtains for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 48-year-old, Lebanese man. He is married and has four children, one of whom works while the others are still studying.

Ahmad is under pressure to provide his family with a respectable way of living. This is why he started his own business. In 2008, he opened a mobile-phone shop, where he also sells recharge cards and all related accessories. 

Today, Ahmad has decided to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional mobile phones and recharge cards for his mobile-phone shop. This Kiva loan will enable him to increase his sales and profits -- thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to expand his business offerings.

loans.use: to purchase additional mobile phones and recharge cards for his mobile-phone shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 21-year-old married woman with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling clothes in South Sudan for two years.

Susan is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a big shop for her business extension.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es:
Brigith, es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de objetos de plástico en general; también vende cd`s  de música y videos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más objetos de plástico, como jarras, containers, etc., para variar su mercadería y obtener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Ella es soltera y tiene una hija, vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Brigith buys and sells general plastic items.  She also sells music CDs and videos.

She needs the loan to buy more plastic items like pitchers and containers, etc. in order to vary her merchandise and get more income to support her family.

She is single and has a daughter.  She lives in a house in “anticretico” (a special rental agreement where a tenant pays a fixed sum upon renting a house, and that sum is returned when the rental period is over) in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the third time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items like pitchers and containers in order to continue with her business of selling plastics.

loans.name: Manuela Josefa

texts.es: Con su credikiva,Manuela compró ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, así mismo invirtió en productos de belleza, como tintes y aliser, todo esto lo vendió, generó un mayor aumento de su capital de trabajo y ahora se prepara para un nuevo credikiva, con el cual planea comprar cosméticos y ropa que comprará a precios de oportunidad y venderá a precios muy competitivos. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: " Agradecimientos por prestarme para capitalizarme en el negocio y mi manera de agradecer es con pagos puntuales. "
texts.en: Manuela used her previous Kiva loan to buy men's, ladies' and children's clothing.  She also invested in buying beauty products such as dyes and hair straightener.  She sold all of these products and increased her working capital.  She is now preparing to take out a new Kiva loan which she plans to use to buy cosmetics and clothing.  She will buy these at discounted prices and sell them at a very competitive price.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you for lending me money so that I can invest in my business.  I will show my thanks by making my repayments on time".

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing which she will buy at discounted prices and sell at a very competitive price

loans.name: Yenny Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Yenny; La socia tiene 36 años de edad; La socia es soltera, La sociael socio tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la administracion de su tienda libreria; la socia tiene su libreria bazr en la provincia de Paucartambo en Pilcopata, ella viaja 8 horas para llevar su mercaderia, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de papeleria, borradores, reglas, escuadras, lapiceros, lapices, folders, vinilos, calculadoras entre muchos productos de escritorio, tambien cuadernos  para la temporada escolar. La socia invertira el prestamo en la compra de utiles escolares y de escritorio.




La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Yenny is a member of the "Siempre Juntos" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Yenny is 36 years old, single, and has two children.  Her business is running a stationery store.  Yenny has a stationery store in Paucartambo province, in Pilcopata.  She travels for eight hours to get her merchandise.  She would like to invest this loan in buying stationery, erasers, rulers, set squares, pencil sharpeners, pencils, folders, vinyl, calculators and other stationery products.  She will also buy exercise books for the new school season.

Yenny will invest her loan in buying school and stationery supplies.  She is grateful for her loan which will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: to invest in buying school and stationery supplies

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
Jose Amílcar, tiene 54 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Cabañitas de San Pedro Sula, está casado desde hace 38 años, quien tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad entre 28 a 36 años.
Don Jose ya tiene tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración de puertas de aluminio y ventanas de celosías, hace puertas corredizas, marcos, puertas abatibles, mesas etc, todo en aluminio y vidrio.
El adquirió mucha experiencia cuando trabajó en una empresa dedicada a este rubro y de sus ahorros comenzó a comprar algunas herramientas y a realizar esta actividad independientemente.
Esta solicitando un préstamo de 12,000.00 para comprar materia prima como láminas de aluminio y vidrio, para realizar trabajos solicitados por los clientes, con el fin de obtener ingresos para mejorar su solvencia económica familiar. Está satisfecho con su trabajo y su préstamo.
Sus metas es comprar más herramientas, crecer en clientes y tener una mejor proyección del negocio.
texts.en:
Jose Amílcar, age 54, lives in the Cabañitas neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  He has been married for 38 years, and he has four adult children between the ages of 28 and 36.

Jose has been making aluminum doors, latticed windows, sliding doors, frames, folding doors, and tables, etc. for three years.  He makes everything in aluminum and glass.

He acquired a lot of experience when he worked for a company in this field.  He used his savings to start buying some tools and to start doing this business activity independently.

He is requesting a loan for 12,000 lempiras to buy raw material like aluminum sheeting and glass in order to do the work requested by his customers.  He will do this in order to get income to improve the family’s financial solvency.  He is happy with his work and his loan.

His goals are to buy more tools, to get more customers, and to have better business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy raw material like aluminum sheeting and glass to make aluminum doors and latticed windows.

loans.name: Carmen Soledad

texts.es:
La socia sigue trabajando como contadora,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local de contabilidad.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mesas y sillas para implementar su local de contabilidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues working as an accountant.  She works from 7.00am to 8.00pm.  Through this work, she would like to get ahead in life.  Her dream is to expand her business premises.  She is requesting this loan to buy tables and chairs for her premises.

The member is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to equip her premises

loans.name: Ingrid Sagrario

texts.es: Ingrid de 38 años  vive en el barrio 7 de Abril con sus tres  hijos en las edades de  8 a 15 años. Desde hace 8 años genera ingresos mediante su negocio de venta de refrescos y bebidas por cajas y también vende al detal, pues tiene un punto frio en su casa, la que con esfuerzos ha logrado levantar, así como un apartamento en otro municipio del departamento, que genera ingresos adicionales. Sus principales clientes son empleados y tiendas del sector  a quienes siempre atiende con vocación de servicio y por eso  su negocio crece cada día más. En la actualidad  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues se debe prepararse  con un buen surtido de cervezas y gaseosas bien frías, para responder a los Carnavales de la ciudad, seguir fidelizando sus clientes, quienes consumen en grandes proporciones bebidas para esta época y con ello generar  más ganancias en corto tiempo. Su sueño es crecer como empresaria, y fortalecer su negocio permanentemente, además de realizarse como mujer y como madre con el éxito de sus hijos y un futuro y buen esposo.
texts.en:
38-year-old Ingrid lives in 7 de Abril neighborhood with her three children who are between 8 and 15 years old.  She has been making income through her business selling drinks, both by the crate and individually, for the past eight years.  She has a cold storage space in her home which she has worked hard to build as well as an apartment in another town in her department which makes her additional income.  Her main customers are employees and stores in her area who she always serves well.  For this reason, her business is continually growing.  

Ingrid is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) as she needs to have a good stock of well-chilled beers and soda ready to respond to the increased demand during the Carnival celebrations in the city.  She must retain the loyalty of her customers who consume drinks in large quantities during this period.  This will make her good profits over a short period of time.  Her dream is to grow as a businesswoman and to permanently strengthen her business.  She would also like to fulfill herself as a woman and as a mother through the success of her children.  She hopes to enjoy a good future.

loans.use: to stock up with well-chilled beer and soda for Carnival

loans.name: Mariela Susan

texts.es: La señora Mariela es una cliente antigua de la institución  se dedica al comercio de ropa, vende ropa variada como ser ropa interior, pantalones, blusas, edredones, frazadillas, entre otros los cuales distribuye de forma ambulante a sus diferentes clientes, ella vive en casa familiar de sus padres al sud este de la ciudad en la zona de Loreto es soltera por el momento ya que con el tiempo piensa formar una familia , la señora indica que el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería ropa interior por mayor y así de esta manera generara ingresos para sustentarse y ayudar con los gastos familiares, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Señora Mariela is a long-standing client of the microfinance institution Emprender. She has a clothing business and sells a variety of clothes, such as underwear, pants, blouses, quilts and blankets, among others. She is a peddler and sells to all kinds of people. She lives in her parents' home in Loreto, a neighborhood in the south-east of her city. She is still single, but considers forming a family in some time.

Mariela says that she will use her loan to buy underwear in bulk to generate more income to provide for her needs and contribute to household expenditures. She is a hard-working person and is happy and grateful to Emprender for its support.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and underwear for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 44-year-old, married man with two children who are three and six years old. He has been running his transport business for approximately two years.  Peter earns about KES 6,000 per month.

Peter is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  He will use the entire loan to buy spare motorcycle parts for his bike.  Peter hopes to own a fleet of public transport vehicles and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy spare motorcycle parts to improve his transport business

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Комил- мужчина 52 лет, женат имеет четверых детей, из которых двое на его иждивении, а двое уже семейные. Его старший сын работает электриком по вызову. Жена домохозяйка, нигде не работает.Комил закупает мужскую обувь на фабрике и продаёт на рынке. У него очень качественный товар, поэтому он имеет своих оптовых покупателей. Кредитуется он у нас уже девятый год, и за эти года смог увеличить ассортимент обуви. На следующий кредит он собирается закупить весенний ассортимент мужской обуви.
texts.en: Komil is a 52-year old man. He is married, with four children, two of whom are his dependents, and two have their own families already. His eldest son works as a freelance electrician. His wife is a homemaker and doesn’t work [outside the home]. Komil buys men’s shoes from a factory and resells it at the market. He has high-quality goods, and this is why he has loyal customers who buy wholesale from him. He has been taking out loans from us for over  eight years, and he was able to expand his stock during this time. He plans to use his next loan to stock up on men’s shoes for the spring season.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of men's shoes for the spring season.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Matilde, tiene 60 años, tiene 4 hijos (2 mujeres y 2 varones), vive en unión libre con su esposo, reside en la comunidad de Tulian, en el Municipio de Omoa.
Ella se desempeñaba anteriormente como ama de llaves en un hotel, hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a la elaboración de dulces de leche en diferentes moldes o formas.
Comenta que inicio su actividad con recursos económicos a través de un préstamo, actualmente desarrolla su producto con la ayuda de su esposo y emplea a 3 personas a tiempo completo tanto en la producción como en la comercialización.
Ya ha tenido experiencia crediticia, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras, los cuales destinará a la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los dulces.
Ella espera lograr estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Matilde, age 60, has four children (two girls and two boys).  She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives in the Tulian community in the Omoa municipality.

She previously worked as a housekeeper in a hotel.  For over four years she has been making "dulce de leche" (a thick, creamy, caramel-like milk-based sauce or spread) in different forms and shapes.  She says that she started her business activity with financial resources from a loan.  She now develops her product with help from her husband, and she hires three people full time as much for production as for commercialization.

She has had loan experience, and she is now requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make the sweets.  She hopes to achieve financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make dulce de leche.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 29 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines.  Her husband, Jayson, is an electrician.  Kristine and Jayson have one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business.  Kristine works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses.

Kristine sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct sales brands like Avon and others.  She purchases a customer’s order in cash and then gives a customer a one-month-to-pay credit.  Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and the profits are the dealer’s income.  Kristine’s regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every week.

Kristine requests a PHP 9,000 loan to help her continue her business operations.  She will be use the loan to buy merchandise and place orders for her customers.  Kristine expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Kristine fervently hopes that her child will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise and products for her direct-sales business.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca Luz, tiene 38 años de edad, está soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos de 19, 24 y 25 años de edad, de los cuales dos ya están casados, vive en la aldea Carrizal de Taulabe, junto a su hijo menor.
Ella tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la fabricación de Cal, este producto es utilizado en las construcciones y también la utilizan en los hogares para cocinar el maíz.  Su proceso es comprar  la piedra y aserrín para quemarla y sacar la cal.
Este negocio es rentable y tiene gran demanda en tiempo de verano.
El préstamo que solicita a ODEF es para comprar materia prima como piedra y aserrín para la fabricación de Cal para la venta.
Con las ganancias obtenidas va apoyar a sus hijos en cuanto tengan alguna necesidad.
texts.en:
Blanca Luz, age 38, is single because she was widowed.  She has three children, ages 19, 24, and 25.  Two of her children are married.  She lives with her youngest child in the village of Carrizal in Taulabe.

For approximately 25 years she has been making lime powder.  This product is used in construction, and it is also used in home to cook corn.  Her process is to buy the rock and sawdust, burn it, and take out the lime powder.

This business is profitable, and there is a great demand in the summer.

The loan she is requesting from ODEF is to buy raw materials like stone and sawdust in order to make the lime powder to sell.  She will use her earnings to support her children when they are in need.

loans.use: to buy stone and sawdust in order to produce lime powder.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, two of whom are working and the others are still studying. Fadel strives to work really hard in order to offer a respectable life for his family. 

He has been working as a truck mechanic since 1990 and has his own garage. He’s well known for his good work and good reputation as well. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed mechanical supplies for his garage in order to carry on his work in a proper way and nonstop without facing problems. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his garage.

loans.use: to purchase the needed mechanical supplies for his garage

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch is 41 years old. She has a common law relationship with her husband and has been blessed with 5 children: 4 are single and one is married. Her second child quit studying due to the family experiencing financial difficulties. Thus, she always helps Ouch in making bamboos baskets at home. 

With the requested amount from HKL and Kiva, Ouch will use the loan to buy wooden boards to replace some broken parts. After mending, Ouch hopes to provide her children with a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: to buy wooden boards to replace some broken parts.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. Since he’s the main income provider for his family, Imad is doing the best he can to satisfy their needs. He opened a furniture workshop in 2002 and already has 15 years of experience in this domain. He has his loyal customers and is looking forward to further expand his business. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added materials for his business such as wood, sponges, furniture paintings and many other items. This Kiva loan will increase his productivity, thus his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his business such as wood, sponges, furniture paintings and many other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 28-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are in school.  For four years, she has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan.

Mary requests this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 45 and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Lolito, a driver.  Isabel is the mother of six children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating their business.  Isabel works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
                            
Isabel operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages in a piecemeal fashion to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo or one egg.  Isabel buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them as individual items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Isabel earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

Isabel is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue business operations.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Isabel hopes to be able to expand her business soon and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Joesline

texts.en: Joesline is 35 years old and married with four children, all of them are still in school. She has a business of selling charcoal. Joesline is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cristeta

texts.en:
This is Cristeta, 47, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married and a mother to her only child. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cristeta retails biscuits and native sweets. What she basically does is buy biscuits and sweet snacks from wholesalers, then she repacks them and sells them per pack with a profit. Products can range from polvoron, regular biscuits and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristeta dreams to expand her business and help her child through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of products needed in her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, age 52. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, in the Philippines. Her husband, Rogelio, is a driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating a recylcing business. At this time, Teresita is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines. While waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They then sell these to junk shops for a profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories. 

Teresita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Teresita is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the money to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Teresita hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy scrap materials needed in her recycling business.

loans.name: Iakob

texts.en:
Iakob lives in the village of Ikalto, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Pati, and 20-year-old daughter and 19-year-old son. Iakob works as a night-watch in a local school. His son works in a local Security Service Company and his daughter is a student. Total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Iakob used to run a pig farm and cultivate family-owned land, but 5 years ago he sold all his pigs in order to get funds for his children's education. Now he has applied for business start-up credit in the frames of the Kiva Start-up program. He will use the requested credit for purchasing pigs and cultivation of the land, where he will sow vegetables. Iakob will sell harvested vegetables, as well as piglets on the local market. 

The income of the family will significantly increase. They will be able to purchase additional household goods, in order to improve family members’ living conditions. Also, Iakob plans to reinvest part of the received income in further development of the pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and pay for land cultivation

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is a 48-year-old farmer from the village of Sartichala in East Georgia. He lives with his family: wife Naile and 19-year-old son. His son is temporarily unemployed.  

Nodar and Naile run a small dairy farm, which is the only source of income for the family. There are two milk cows on the farm.  Naile produces cheese and sells on average 40 kg of this product in the local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 300 Laris. 

Nodar requested credit to expand their dairy farm.  He will purchase a milk cow. With three milk cows, the family will be able to increase the production and sales of cheese by 50%. Their monthly income will grow by 150 Laris.  With the increased income, Nodar plans to create better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en:
Guguli is a 59-year-old farmer from the village Geguti, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband – Amiran, 33-year-old son, and two grandsons (6 and 4 years old). The family has 2 milk cows. They produce dairy products, part of which is consumed by the family and the surplus is sold in the local market. According to Credo's estimations, Guguli’s family belongs to the subsistent poor. Guguli has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the local government. 

Guguli requested credit to start up a new business. She will purchase construction materials and hire workers to construct a greenhouse with an area of 500 sq meters. She will grow greens and tomatoes in the greenhouse.  The harvested products will be sold to local greengrocery retailers. This initiative will significantly increase her family’s income and they will be able to combat poverty and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: build a greenhouse

loans.name: Bahja Group

texts.en:
This group is called BAHJA and consists of four members: Bahja, Fwziah, Najmah and Sabrin. They live in Aden, Yemen and they are in their 19th loan cycle. By working together they have been able to help each other and thus be able to improve their quality of life.They requested a loan of 200,000 YER.

Bahja is the group leader. She is 38 and a married woman and has eight children.  Her group is called by her name. (She is standing in the centre  holding a white handbag.) She works selling clothes and has been operating her business for seven years.

She started out in business selling small quantities of clothing from her home. She worked hard and gradually increased her sales. She now sells her products in the public market. She is a dynamic and hard-working woman, always putting forth the maximum effort in order to be able to give her family everything they need so they do not lack for any type of necessity.

Bahja went to AMB to ask for a loan of 50,000 YER in order to buy buy additional stock of clothes such as dresses, fabrics, and other items. She would like her children to study so that they can enjoy a better future. And she also wants to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothes such as dresses, fabrics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mahoukpehou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUKPEHOU est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Faustin est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Faustin est âgé de 49 ans et vit au Bénin. Faustin a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Faustin est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Albertine. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Faustin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges, Faustin vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des chemises dans une ville du Bénin De façon secondaire, Faustin vend des tissus. Faustin s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Faustin sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUKPEHOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUKPEHOU consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. They are seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the second time to bolster their activity. The group’s representative is Faustin, whose hand is raised in the photo. Faustin is 49 years old and he lives in Benin. He attended secondary school. He is married to a reseller named Albertine.
