El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de suministros como tintas, papeles y otros para su imprenta.
texts.en:
Betsy is a member of Ccori Soncco Communal Bank.  She has her printing business.  She likes FINCA because they teach her to save, and she also likes the training because they teach the women how to get ahead.  She is proud because she is teaching her children with her effort.  Thanks to FINCA Peru she was able to buy herself some machines, such as printers, and stock up to do her job.  She likes the training in which they teach her to value herself as a woman.

She will invest the loan she is requesting now in buying supplies such as ink, paper, and other supplies for her press.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: John Kimisik

texts.en: John's business is doing well and he has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels. He wishes to grow his business and to be able to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has had a business selling breads in Buluk, South Sudan. Viola is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is 40 years old and has been in the poultry business for the past six years. She is married to David, and they have four children between the ages of 6 and 17. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more chicks to add to her stock. In the future, Lilly hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is 49 years old and married to William. They have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her business. In the future, Albina hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Damarise

texts.en:
Damarise, aged 28, is a mother of two children who are five and eight years of age. All of the children go to school. Her husband works as a businessman.

Damarise has been selling different items in a boutique for 4 years. She wants a loan to add more items such as sodas, rice and sugar in the boutique. With the profits, she plans to buy a plot of land for digging.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods such as sodas, rice and sugar to sell in the boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for having a front wall built and to install a front door.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Neema », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 30  ans, célibataire, mère d’un jeune enfant, qui étudie. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers de pommes de terre, huile, farine, Fanta, lait, tomates, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir son enfant grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, leader of the business group “Neema," is a 30-year-old entrepreneur.  She is also a single mother with one young child who attends school.  She is a restaurant associate.  For four years she has been involved in these income-generating activities. Nonetheless, she just completed her eighth loan from Hekima.

This new loan will have to allow her to stock up with two baskets of potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, milk, tomatoes, etc.  Moreover, she hopes to see her child grow up comfortable and to expand her business.  The borrower thanks Hekima for their actions benefitting poor women outside the realm of classical banking.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, milk, tomatoes, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 43 years old. She is a mother of 2 children aged 1 and 17 years. She has been selling clothes for the past 4 years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to add to the inventory. With the profits she will build a house for her residence.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Donatienne

texts.en: Donatienne is a mother of three children, aged between three and 10 years. With the loan, Donatienne will buy different items to sell in the boutique, which she has been involved in for 16 years. Donatienne will use the profits to reinvest in the same business. She aims high for the future.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Azizakhan

texts.ru: Азизакан 53 года, имеет четырех детей.  С 2000 года Азизакан занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, где на данный момент есть две дойные коровы и тридцать овец,  приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также Азизакан занимается полеводством, возделывая 0,94 га с хлопком. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Азизакан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS). Часть доходов от кредита Азизакан планирует вложить в оплату контракта на учебу младших сына и дочери, и часть - в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Azizakhan is 53 years old and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000.  The business, started with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS), currently has two dairy cows and thirty sheep and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Azizakhan is also involved in farming and plants cotton on 0.94 hectares of land.  In order to further expand her business, Azizakhan requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest some of the profits from the loan into paying for her youngest son's and daughter's education contract, and some into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо занимается животноводством. Она у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. В этой области она пять лет. Нигинамо замужем. Ей 40 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она берет кредит для закупа двух телят и бычка.
texts.en: Niginamo is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds cattle at home.  She has been in this business for five years.  Niginamo is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She is requesting this loan to buy two calves and a bull.

loans.use: to buy two calves and a bull

loans.name: Jamiya

texts.ru: Чамия жительница района Хамадони. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается животноводством. Чамия закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Она берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Jamiya is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  Jamiya buys livestock for future resale.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de accesorios de computadoras y de computadoras portatiles en su domicilio. La socia a ampliado su negocio para acomodar sus computadoras y sus portatiles. y tambien invertir en la compra de un par de computadoras mas; La socia solicita el prestamo para comprar vitrinas y  computadoras y así acomodar sus laptops.
texts.en: This associate continues with her business of selling computer accessories and laptops out of her home. The associate has expanded her business to accommodate the computers and laptops. She is requesting a loan to buy glass cases to display her computers, as well as comupters.

loans.use: to purchase glass cases and laptops

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefa; ella es conviviente y tiene 48 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa, habas y arvejas, la socia estos productos lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal es porque la socia pidio permiso por motivo de trabajo. 

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de carne, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de ganadería, negocio de  agricultura, negocio de crianza de cuyes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan". This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. 

One of the group members is Josefa. She is 48 years old and is married with 6 children. She makes a living as a farmer. She has land where she plants crops of potatoes, fava beans and peas. She sells her products in different markets in the district of Anta. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. It is as a result of this work that she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her farming land. She has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops. The member who is in the small photo was not able to be present at the group photo for work reasons. 

The other members of the group make a living selling meat, raising animals, selling livestock, farming and raising guinea pigs.  

Josefa thanks those who are involved in making her dream possible and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: El Triunfo Del Amor Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Triunfo del Amor esta integrado por  cinco  mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de hacer crecer sus negocios y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora  Cristina una señora trabajadora y humilde  que se dedica a la venta de joyería, artesanías y utensilios de barro.
Ella nos cuenta que sale a vender a  las colinas de su localidad  ya que tiene muchos clientes  que le hacen pedidos y la recomienda ya que siempre tiene los pedidos a tiempo y se los va entregar a domicilio.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Efraín Efrén un señor trabajador y humilde con quien tiene  dos hijos por quien los dos trabajan ya que desean darle  una buena educación.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas  joyas y artesanías para  la venta de mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son:
María  Luisa- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Candida Juliana- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Remedios-se dedica a la venta de calzado.
María Magdalena- se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha brindado ya que desean mejorar sus negocios y darle un mejor futuro a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "El Triunfo del Amor" group is made up of five hard-working women who want to make their businesses grow, and have a better quality of life.

One of the members of the group is Cristina, a hard-working and modest lady who sells jewelry, handicrafts, and clay cooking utensils. She tells us that she goes to sell in the hills around the town, as she has a lot of customers who place orders with her, and recommend her because she always fills the orders on time and provides home delivery.

She is happily married to Efraín Efrén, a hard-working and modest man.  They have two children for whose sake both of them work, as they wish to give them a good education. She asked for the loan to buy more jewelry and handicrafts to sell at wholesale and retail. The others members of the group are María Luisa who sells shoes, Candida Juliana who sells perfumes, Remedios who sells shoes, and María Magdalena who sells costume jewelry. 

They are thankful to the Foundation for they support they have been offered, as they wish to improve their businesses, and give a better future to their families.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Pedro Moises

texts.es:
Moises sigue perteneciendo en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. 

Moises sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo.
 
Moises continúa produciendo artesanía como por ejemplo escultura de la cultura Inka y pre Inka en miniaturas con piedra serpentina por ejemplo hace replica de la ciudad Machu Picchu. Moisés con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Moisés en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más material como la piedra serpentina que lo trae de la ciudad de aguas calientes. (La ciudad de Aguas Calientes está ubicada a 110 kilómetros del Cusco).  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Moises continues as a member of one of Asociación Arariwa's community banks which is located in Cusco department.  This community bank is in its third year and all its members are doing well. 

Moises continues living in the historic city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Most people in the city of Cusco work in tourism-related businesses and  services.

Moises continues making handicrafts.  He makes miniature sculptures that reflect Incan and pre-Incan culture out of serpentine stone.  For example, he makes replicas of the city of Machu Picchu.  Moises did very well with his previous loan and was able to increase his income.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy more materials such as serpentine stone that he brings in from the city of Agua Calientes (110 kilometers from Cusco).

Moises is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given and pledges to make his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy serpentine stone for making miniature sculptures

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

La socia sigue trabajando como profesora. Ya son varios años que trabaja en un colegio. La socia también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de manualidades para compromisos sociales como matrimonios, bautizos y confirmaciones, ella nos cuenta que hace sus manualidades en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio, ella tambien tiene un restaurante. La socia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para seguir elaborando manualidades. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member continues to belong to Inti Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the department of Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is in its third year of operations and it is going very well for all the members.  ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language that translated into Spanish means "Sol" 'sun.')

The member continues working as a teacher of handicrafts.  She has been working for several years already in the school.  She also has a small business selling handicrafts for social obligations such as weddings, baptisms, and confirmations.  She tells us that she makes her handicrafts in the small workshop that she set up in her home.  Currently she needs the loan to buy materials to continue making her crafts.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she also promises to make her payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Mariée  et mère de 6 enfants, Madame Bintou est âgée de 46 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Bintou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des fruits, légumes et tubercules il y a 12 ans. Elle trouve que cette activité lui procure de revenus et que ça marche très bien.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 7 ans.  Après  5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 9eme prêt  individuel et tous les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, des paniers de bananes et des paniers de pomme de terre. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et à Sikasso et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  constitué de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro,  participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: A married mother of six, Mrs. Bintou is 46 years old and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their children in the city of Koutiala. For social reasons, Bintou didn’t have the chance to continue her elementary school studies, and she quickly became interested in earning money. After having failed at several businesses, she ended up opting to sell fruits, vegetables and tubers twelve years ago. She finds that this business generates a lot of money and works really well. In order to satisfy her clientele in quality and quantity by increasing the size of her business, she decided to turn to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. After having properly repaid five group loans, she is on her ninth individual loan, and all of her previous loans were repaid without difficulty. With this new loan, she plans to buy baskets of bananas and potatoes. She stocks up at different weekly fairs in villages neighboring Koutiala and in Sikasso, and sells her goods at the grand market of Koutiala to a clientele consisting of women and men, for cash or credit. She foresees earning an average of 150,000 FCFA per month, which she envisions using to repay the Soro loan, paying for family expenses, and investing back into her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and potatoes

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 28-year-old single lady from Nakuru. She has been in the soap-making business for the past three years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend, and this will be her first loan. Mildred plans to use the loan to buy new ingredients for making soap. 

In the future, Mildred hopes to start a business distributing powdered soap.

loans.use: To buy soap ingredients to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 35 years old. She is married to a house builder. She sells different items in a warehouse that she has been running for the past 19 years. She has requested this loan to buy more construction materials to stock her warehouse. With the profits she wants to solve the basic problems that have been persisting in her family such as access to basic needs. She also wants to save the remaining profits. In the future, she would like to be the sole distributor of construction materials.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials

loans.name: Tadjikhan

texts.ru:
Тажихан проживает в селе Бургонду на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Тажихан  откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2007 году с кредитом компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в  сумме30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Тажихан в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров и 4 овцы;  продажа молока и молочных продуктов позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также на поливной земле в 0,84 га Тажихан выращивает хлопок, что в сезон урожая приносит прибыль от продажи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Тажихан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и  перепродажи, и семян хлопка.    Доходы Тажихан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить контракт на обучение для своей младшей дочери.
texts.en: Tadjikhan lives in the Burgondu village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Much like many other families in the rural area, she fattens up livestock, after starting this business in 2007 with a loan from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Today, Tadjikhan has two heads of dairy cows and four sheep in her business, and sales of milk products and meat allow her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Tadjikhan also grows cotton on 0.84 hectares of irrigated land, and earns a profit from sales during the harvesting season. In order to further expand her business, Tadjikhan requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale and to buy cotton seeds. She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount in order to have an ability to pay for her youngest daughter's education contract.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 14, 10, and four years, respectively. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she ventured into 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 that she will use to purchase bales of clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will help her educate her children and build a house. 

Her dream is to see her business expand and to meet the needs of her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife. In order to live properly and be able to satisfy his family's needs, Mohsen works really hard. He’s an independent contractor specialized in floor covering and has been working in this domain for eighteen years. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new floor-cleaning machine plus additional construction supplies. These supplies, and the machine as well, will facilitate his work and allow him take on more projects. In the future, he plans to renew his tools and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To purchase a new floor-cleaning machine plus additional construction supplies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne, a 46-year-old mother of four children between the ages of 14 and 24, all enrolled in school, is married to a security guard. She has been selling clothes for the past 20 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. Julienne plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a 23-year-old married man. He describes himself to be honest and trustworthy. 

Isaiah operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables such as kale and tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a location that is conducive to the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of vegetables.

Isaiah will use the loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more kale, tomatoes, and other vegetables to sell. His business goal is to use the generated profits from his grocery store to run another similar grocery stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as kale and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 53-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working for 22 years in manufacturing herbal beauty creams. His trade is going fine but needs to be supported with updated machines to keep it up to date.

Nizar also owns a small cottage in a school, where he sells candies, chips, and sandwiches. Both businesses are very important to him. They help in supporting his family's financial situation.

Nizar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new, updated machines necessary for his business. This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he places a lot of hope on this loan for future investments and to keep an important inheritance for his son.

loans.use: To buy new, updated machines for his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children aged one year and nine years. She describes herself as honest. 

Susan operates a retail store, where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, rice, black beans, etc. She has been involved with this business for five years. Her business is located at a shopping center, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to venture within the next five years into a maize-grinding store commonly known as a "posho mill" in the local language.

loans.use: To buy more stock in cereals such as maize, grains, and peas

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from six to 12 years. She describes herself as honest. 

Eunice operates a beauty salon commonly known as "Wa Tony's Salon," where she provides services such as hairdressing and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a shopping center, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the beauty salon. 

Eunice will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase more beauty products. Eunice's business goal is to run three other similar beauty salons within five years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señorita Guadalupe esta sola en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo,toda su familia radica en la ciudad de Matamoros Tamaulipas. Esta trabajando y estudiando y así ayudarse económica mente. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que se accidento y necesita comprar un medicamento y realizarse unos estudios y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar esta necesidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como encargada de una Agencia. Desea mejorar su salud y calidad de vida ya que tiene muchos proyectos para su futuro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives alone in the town of Nuevo Laredo, as all of her family lives in the town of Matamoros Tamaulipas. She is studying as well as working in order to economically support herself.
She is requesting a loan because she has had an accident and she needs to buy a medicine and to pay for some medical examinations, and she does not have enough money to pay this needs.
She is the manager of an agency and she plans on repaying the loan thanks to her salary. She wants to improve her health as well as her standard of living, as she has many projects for her future.

loans.use: To buy a medicine and to pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Confiando En Dios 4 Group

texts.en:
Laura is the coordinator of her group Confiando en Dios (Trusting in God) 4. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children; being a single mother, she has been working very hard to raise and provide for her children.

Laura is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She is selling clothes, and she will buy different clothing for men and women. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to live in a foreign country with her family, and to give a good education to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Cheny

texts.en:
Cheny earns a living through farming. She is a married woman with a two-year-old child. 

Cheny tills land in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing and selling rice for three years. She earns about 3,500 PHP per month doing this farming. 

Cheny works hard to support her family and save for her child's education. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

In the future, Cheny hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Nzambe Malamu Plus Group

texts.en:
Marcel, 50, is married and the father of two daughters aged fifteen and nine years old. Both daughters attend school. He started his business in 2002, managing his own general store located mid-east of the city of Kinshasa. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $70.

Marcel is the chairman of the Community Bank named “Nzambe Malamu Plus,” which is composed of ten members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marcel is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE DRC and has already received nine different loans and repaid them properly. He intends to use his portion of this $6,000 loan to purchase goods to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. His ambition is to have a food market in his area.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for his store to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio has had a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for five years. He is a 31-year-old married man with two children aged 10 and seven. 

Joven can earn as much as 10,000 PHP with his business. Joven works hard to support his family and send his kids to school. He is planning to start another business to augment his income.

Jovencio has requested this loan to purchase spare motorcycle parts and gasoline and pay for tune-up service. Jovencio hopes to earn more and sustain his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase spare motorcycle parts and gasoline and pay for tune-up service

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
40-year-old Roger is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has had his "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business for three years. 

Roger earns 3,000 PHP per month with his business. He works hard to improve his income. Roger is hoping to have another business to augment his income and save for his children's education.

Roger requested this loan to renew his license. He hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To renew his license

loans.name: Loma Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama  loma bonita  y se integra de cuatro señoras quien cada una se dice  a su respectiva actividad.
 
    Quien  se le tomo la entrevista se  llama  Maria  Ysabet,  quien es casada con el señor  Carmelino   y con quien procreo  dos hijos quienes ya   están casados.

    Solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo  en la compra  y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros, niñas, y niños en donde lleva trabajando   seis años  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha  obtenido muy buenos ingresos para su  familia.

       Inicio con esta  actividad ya que también quiere apoyar a su  esposo  con los ingresos de la casa y así juntos  trabajar para darle lo más necesario a su  hogar.

      Lo  que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando mientras  las sigan apoyando en con el préstamo y hasta que dios la siga prestando vida.

    Las personas que integran en  el grupo son: Francisca  quien invertirá en la compra de  quesos, Gabriela invertirá en combustible para su carro de transporte y Asbeli del Carmen quien  invertirá en la compra  y venta de ropas.
texts.en:
This group is called Loma Bonita and is made up of four women who each conduct their respective business.

María Ysabet is married to Carmelino and they have had two sons who are already married.

She requested the loan to invest in the buying and selling of women's, men's, girl's, and boy's clothing where she has worked for six years. She says that things are going well for her since her job has provided her with good earnings for her family.

She began this business since she also wants to support her husband with the household earnings, and in this way, work together to give that which is most necessary to her home.

She wishes most of all that with this small business she can continue working while they continue supporting them with the loan and until God continues giving her life.

The people in the group are: Francisca, who will invest in buying cheese; Gabriela, who will invest in fuel for her transportation vehicle; and Asbeli de Carmen, who will invest in buying and selling clothing.

loans.use: para pagar la compra de ropas para niñas, niños, damas y caballeros.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora elida es una persona muy trabajadora cuenta con 50 años de edad y está casada con el señor Florencio con quien tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella tiene un pequeña fonda desde hacen 12 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este buen negocio ya que es muy rentable y le deja buenas ganancias, las cuales le ayudaran para apoyar a su esposo, con los gastos de la casa, también para contar con una mejor solvencia económica y nivel de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas insumos como: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, papas, maíz, sal, aceite, carnes, pollo, arroz, frijol, etc.

Doña elida dice que una de las metas para su negocio es la de continuar invirtiéndole muchísimo, ya que tiene como objetivo hacerlo crecer aun mas, puesto que quiere ampliar su local, para comprar más mesas y sillas ya que así mejorara e incrementara sus ganancias.

Ella está muy agradecida con fundación realidad, pero sobre todo con los prestatarios por la confianza y apoyo que le están brindando, ya que dice gracias a esta ayuda ahora tiene un mejor negocio y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elida is a very hardworking person.  She’s 50 years old and married to Florencio; they have three children who are all married now.  She has been making food to sell for 12 years.

She says that she decided to start this good business because it’s very profitable and produces good profits that help her help her husband with household expenses and to have better economic solvency and living standard.  The loan she got will be used to buy more ingredients like: chilies, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, corn, salt, oil, meats, chicken, rice, beans, etc.

Elida says that one of the goals she has for her business is to invest very much into it because her goal is to make it grow still more because she wants to enlarge it and to buy more tables and chairs to improve and increase her profits.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad but above all to the lenders for the trust and support they are providing her because she says that thanks to this help she now has a better business and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando de 30 años es el propietario de un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad, que inició producto de su tradición familiar, ya que sus padres se dedicaron a esta actividad y él debió asumir el control, al enfermar su padre. Su negocio desde hace 12 años, ha tenido muchas modificaciones de infraestructura, porque ha ido creciendo. Así mismo  en honor a su padre puso el nombre que hoy lleva este restaurante.  En su negocio trabaja con su hermano y un auxiliar en el proceso productivo, que son su mano derecha.  Hernando está muy satisfecho con esta actividad, con la que  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos en las edades de 13 años, 4 y 6 meses de nacido.   Actualmente la época carnavalera,  trae consigo un gran incremento en sus ventas y su capital de trabajo, se torna insuficiente para responder a esta demanda y ofrecer precios competitivos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará refrescos y bebidas, además de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos. Estas compras la realizará de contado y en mayor volumen,  lo cual disminuye el porcentaje de sus costos y es justamente lo que motiva el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en: Hernando, who is 30 years old, is the proprietor of a restaurant in the center of the city, which he began as the result of a family tradition, since his parents worked in this business and he had to assume control because his father became sick. It has been his business for 12 years, and he has made many modifications in the infrastructure, because it has been growing. Also, to honor his father, he gave the restaurant the name that it carries today. In his business he works with his brother and an assistant in the production process, and they are his right hand. Hernando is very satisfied with this business, with which he has managed to raise his family, which consists of his wife and three children, ages 13, 4, and 6 months. Now the carnival season is approaching, and it brings with it a great increase in his sales, and his working capital becomes insufficient to respond to this demand and offer competitive prices. This is the reason why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first financing that he will receive from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy soft drinks and beverages, in addition to ingredients to prepare his foods. He will make these purchases for cash and in large volume, which will decrease a percentage of his costs and is precisely what motivates the success of his investment.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and beverages, and ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
47-year-old Esterlita is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has five children aged between two and 26 years old. Esterlita works hard to feed her family and keep them healthy. She also makes her children's education a priority.

Esterlita's husband operates their fishing boat while she sells their catch at the town's market. Esterlita has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI to buy fishing nets and repair their fishing boat. She hopes this loan will help to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and to repair the couple's fishing boat.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with a 4-year-old child. 

Josephine has had her sari-sari store business for 11 years. She sells items like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, toiletries, and spices. Josephine also supports her husband, who is a fisherman. She helps sell fresh fish and crabs at the market. Josephine works hard to support her family and build her business. 

She requested a loan to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries, and soft drinks. Josephine hopes for their businesses to grow. She also hopes to be a crab buyer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, toiletries, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, a 34-year-old married father of two children aged five and seven, describes himself as an ambitious and shrewd businessman. For the past five years he has been operating a grocery stall selling fruits such as watermelons, bananas, mangoes, etc. His business is located along a busy road, and his primary customers are pedestrians.

Describing his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fruits, Francis is requesting a loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more vegetables and fruits. His business goal is to run more grocery stalls within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El  señor Jose, tiene 54 años, tiene 4 hijas entre las edades de 14 a 23 años, esta casado, reside en la comunidad de El Coyol, en el Municipio de Saba, Colón.
Don José cuenta con un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica, manteca, sopas, consomé, baterías y productos de aseo y limpieza.
Con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos, cuenta además con un laboratorio dental donde ofrece el servicio de  extracciones y limpiezas. La esposa y sus hijas se dedican a atender el negocio de la pulpería.
Recientemente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 lempiras, los que espera invertir en el surtido de más productos alimenticios.
Don José espera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan continuar apoyando a sus hijas en el estudio.
texts.en:
José, age 54, has four daughters between the ages of 14 and 23.  He is married, and he lives in the El Coyol community in the Saba municipality, Colón.

José has a grocery store where he sells food staples, lard, soups, consommés, batteries, and hygiene and cleaning products.  His wife and daughters tend to this business.

He has recently requested a loan for 10,000 lempiras to stock his store with more food products.

José hopes to get better income, which will allow him to continue supporting his daughters’ education.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, 40, is married and has two children aged eighteen and thirteen years. She describes herself as very determined.

For the past four years Dorothy has operated a beauty salon where she provides services such as hairdressing and sells beauty products. Her salon is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to improve her salon.

Dorothy will use her 20,000 KES loan from SMEP to purchase more beauty products. Her goal is to run a well-established beauty and cosmetics salon within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to use and sell in her salon.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, a 42-year-old mother of four children and wife of a farm laborer, earns a living through food vending. She makes banana cue, pancakes, rice cakes and other snacks that she sells to her community, earning 5000 php per month.

Now requesting a loan to purchase cookware and ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil, Zenaida hopes for her business to grow. She also wishes to send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cookware and ingredients such as flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero, y vive con sus padres y hermanos  en la colonia Los Laureles, Negrito, Yoro. 
La actividad económica de Marcos es la agricultura específicamente el cultivo de arroz. El creció junto con su familia ejerciendo esta actividad, en la cual hace 4 años logro independizarse mediante esfuerzos propios. Cultiva una manzana de terreno donde produce arroz por inundación siendo este de primera calidad. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local, a esta actividad le dedica  6 horas diarias.
El esta solicitando su primer préstamo con ODEF, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante e insumos para el cultivo de arroz. Esperando mejorar su producción y sacar una buena cosecha.
Su plan es ampliar el área del  cultivo y darle mejor asistencia.
texts.en:
Marcos is 21 years old and single.  He lives with his parents and siblings in the Los Laureles neighborhood, Negrito, Yoro.

Marcos is a farmer.  Specifically, he grows rice.  He grew up together with his family, and they exercised the same business activity.  Four years ago,  through his own efforts, he started farming independently.  He cultivates a “manzana” (7,00 square meters) of land where he produces rice by flooding, this being the best quality.  He sells this production at the local market.  He devotes six hours a day to this business activity.

He is requesting his first loan with ODEF in order to buy fertilizers and supplies for his rice crop.  He is hoping to improve production and obtain a good harvest.

His plan is to expand the area he cultivates and to give it better care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for his rice crop.

loans.name: Barrio  Shiñuu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Barrio Shiñuu  esta integrado por  once  personas trabajadoras con deseos de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida para poder  ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes de el grupo es la señora  Carmen  Cristina  una señora de cuarenta y nueve años de edad es  soltera  y muy trabajadora.
Ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de herramientas mecánicas desde hace cuatro años ,también se dedica a la elaboración de arreglos para bodas, quince  años y bautizos.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es darle un buen servicio a sus clientes para que le vuelva a comprar.
Ella Pidio el préstamo para la compra de mas herramientas mecánicas para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Lizet-quien se dedica a la venta de  bisutería.
Irineo-quien se dedica a la venta de herramientas mecánicas.
Juan Diego-quien se dedica a la venta de herramientas mecánicas.
Justina Azucena-quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
María Estela-quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.
Guadalupe-quien se dedica a la venta de zapatos.
Carmen –quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Juana  Cristina -quien se dedica a la venta de  calzado.
Mariana Marina-quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Elizabeth-quien se dedica a la venta de calzado.

Le dan las gracias fundación por ayudar a las personas que desean tener una mejor calidad de vida y un negoció propio.
texts.en:
The "Barrio Shiñuu" group is made up of eleven hard-working  people who want to get ahead and succeed in life, in order to offer a better life to their families. 

Carmen Cristina is one of the members of the group. She is 49, single, and very hard-working.

She tells us that she has been selling mechanic's tools for four years, and also makes flower arrangements for weddings, coming-out parties for 15-year-olds, and baptisms.

What she likes best about her business is giving good service to her clients, so that they buy from her again.

She asked for the loan, in order to buy more mechanic's tools for sale at wholesale and retail.

The other members of the group are Lizet, who sells costume jewelry; Irineo and Juan Diego who sell mechanic's tools; Justina Azucena who sells clothing; María Estela, who sells groceries; Carmen who sells fruits and vegetables; and Juana Cristina, Mariana Marina, and Elizabeth who sell shoes.

They are thankful to the Foundation for helping people who wish to have their own business, and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy mechanic's tools for sale.

loans.name: Hastina

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 46-year-old Hastina from Tengbeh in western Freetown. She is married with two children aged nine and nineteen years. Both attend school.

For the past ten years Hastina has run a building materials store where she sells cement, shovels, zinc, nails, etc. She works ten hours a day, seven days a week and has one employee. The family also gets money from her husband who works in the provinces. Hastina says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of a vehicle to deliver materials to her customers.

Hastina has requested a 5,000,000 SLL loan from BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy more building materials to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family.

In the future, Hastina plans to open a construction company. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Adama from Tengbeh town in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with one two-year-old child.

In 1995, Adama established a business selling slippers. She did so because most foreigners like leather slippers and she wanted a steady source of income to help provide for her family. She works six days a week, twelve hours a day. She says that her business is doing well.

Adama would like a 4,000,000 SLL loan from BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy different kinds of slippers to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

In the future, Adama plans to open more slipper shops in other areas within her township, be the general overseer of her business, and continue to care for the needs of her family. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy different kinds of slippers to sell.

loans.name: Nouvelle Vision Plus Group

texts.en:
“Nouvelle Vision” is a group of 20 owners of small businesses chaired by Ray. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Ray, a 20-year-old single man, operates a cellphone booth and is a money changer, earning US$60 of profit per week. In business for seven years, he is a hard-working man with demonstrable business abilities such as organisation and good management. He knows how to attract his customers by offering what they need and like. He is also diplomatic when he talks with his clients.

Ray, a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received and repaid two loans, is requesting a new loan to buy dozens of prepaid cards to resell at profit in order to meet high customer demand and generate more profits. Ray’s ambition is to become a prominent prepaid-card provider in his community.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of prepaid cards to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio tiene una vidriería, el  es casado con la señora Alicia, actualmente viven por la zona los chacos con sus hijos en una casa en alquiler. Ambos se dedican al taller de vidriería, desde hace más de dos años. Su negocio esta ubicado por una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, les va muy bien con esta actividad por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de vidrios por mayor para surtir su tienda ya que tiene mucha clientela, El Sr. Antonio es una persona muy trabajadora,  esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia,  agradecieron a la institución por la oportunidad brindada y también agradecieron por la rapidez con la que se lo atendió ya que gracias a este apoyo crecerá en su negocio e incrementara sus ingresos mejorando de esta manera su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Antonio has a glazier's shop. He is married to Señora Alicia. They now live with their children in a rented house in the Los Chacos zone. They both work in the glazier's shop and have been doing this for more than two years. Their business is located on a very busy street in the city of Santa Cruz.  They are doing well with this business, and for this reason he applied for a loan to buy glass wholesale to stock his store, since he has a lot of customers. Sr. Antonio is a very hard-working person. This is the only activity with which he supports his family. They are grateful to the institution for the opportunity that is offered, and they are also appreciative of the rapidity with which they were helped, since thanks to this support, he will grow in his business and will increase his income, in this way improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy glass to stock his glazier's shop

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de contadora,ella tiene un estudio de contable donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el consultorio de contadora . La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su estudio contable para comprar un escritorio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues to work as an accountant. She has an accountant's office where she works from 8 am to 7 pm. Through this business she is raising her son. Her dream is to enlarge her accountant's business. She is applying for the loan to buy a desk to furnish her accountant's office.

She is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy a desk to furnish her accountant's office

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Aminata from Tengbeh town in western Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of twelve and 25 years.

For the past twenty-five years Aminata has sold bulgur, native rice, beans, groundnuts, pepper, etc. from her shop. She works seven days a week, eight hours a day. Her husband also sells beef in the same marketplace. She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting her goods from the countryside to the city.

Aminta has requested a 5,000,000 SLL loan from BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy more bulgur, native rice, beans, groundnuts and pepper to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL and allow her to educate her children.

In the future, Aminta plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more bulgur, native rice, beans, groundnut and pepper.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.en: Vicentina is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco.  Vicentina is 35 years old and lives with a partner and her two daughters who are 2.5 and 13 years old. Vicentina runs a beauty salon where she offers all types of services such as hair and makeup.  She has 15 years of experience in the business and dreams of renting another location in order to expand her customer base. Vicentina is requesting a loan in order to purchase beauty products for her salon. Her greatest wish is to ensure that her children complete their education.

loans.use: buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Cesar is 24 years old and single. He owns and operates a metal workshop with his brother. For the last eight years, Cesar has worked in the shop constructing all types of metal structures for his customers, including verandas, stairs, handrails, windows, furniture, and doors.

Cesar is requesting a loan in order to purchase metal working materials such as machinery, tools, and sheet metal. Cesar hopes that continued investment will allow him to expand his business from a metal workshop into a factory.

loans.use: buy metal working machinery, tools, and sheet metal

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Elena is 44 years old and married with three children, ages 1.5, 10, and 19.  Elena owns a small stand in the market where she sells clothing and accessories.  Her shop offers styles for both children and adults, as well as items such as lipstick, nail polish, belts, and shoes. 

Elena has run her business for 10 years, and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more inventory for her shop. Elena hopes that her success will allow her to pay for her children’s education and to remodel her house.

loans.use: buy inventory for her clothing and accessories shop

loans.name: Flora Virginia

texts.en:
Flora Virginia is 56 years old and married with three children aged twenty, thirty, and 32 years. She has thirty years of experience as a high school educator, teaching language and communications.

Flora Virginia is one of twelve members of the village bank, “Luz del Sur,” located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. She is requesting a 1,000 PEN loan from Asociación Arariwa in order to produce and sell educational materials. Having spent a number of years developing her curriculum, she seeks to systematize her experience so that she can transfer her knowledge to others.

Flora Virginia’s dream is to see all of her children complete their university education.

loans.use: to produce and sell educational materials.

loans.name: Nohelia

texts.en: Nohelia is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Nohelia is 31 years old and is a single mother with a 12-year-old daughter.  Nohelia operates a juice stand where she blends fresh fruits such as papayas, pineapples, and bananas for thirsty customers. She has been in the business for 13 years and is requesting a loan in order to purchase ingredients such as fruit and milk as well as appliances. Nohelia dreams of owning her own juice shop one day.

loans.use: buy ingredients and appliances for her juice stand

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en: Antonieta is 58 years old and lives in Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. Antonieta owns a fish-vending business and earns approximately PHP1,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP1,500 to purchase more fish to sell. Antonieta has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Antonieta hopes to earn money for her and her husband's future because they are already old and need to have savings.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is married with ten children.
 
Gloria has a farm supplies business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to  purchase more equipment for her farm supplies business. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Gloria hopes to earn enough money for their children because they want to finish their  studies for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her farm supplies business

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). 

She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Sokhom is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a piece of farmland for growing more agricultural crops to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing more agricultural crops

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо жительница района Хамадони. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Она занимается животноводством. В основном она откармливает и продет крупнорогатый скот. В этой области Точинисо два года. Она берет кредит для закупа овец.
texts.en: Tojiniso is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is 21 years old, single and lives with her parents.  She is involved in animal husbandry and primarily fattens up and sells cattle.  Tojiniso has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting this loan to buy sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Las Gaviotas De Soto Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Las Gaviotas  de Soto y esta  conformado por  tres  personas  un hombres y dos mujeres ,son gente humilde trabajadora y amables.
El representante del grupo es el señor Félix  de setenta y nueve años de edad ,  se dedica a la venta y  crianza  de ganando desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente  casado con  la señora Gloria una señora trabajadora , don Félix nos cuenta que para alimentar su ganado se va desde muy temprano  con su garrafón de agua  y sus tortillas para que almuerse  y coma ya que se regresa a su casa como a las seis de la tarde, entonces él sale con su ganado para pastar y darles de beber y al siguiente día tiene que ordeñar  para que doña Gloria elabore los sabrosos quesos .
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ganado y alimento para su vacas  ya que debe de alimentarlos bien para que a la hora de venderlos pesen mucho y se vean bien bonitos.
Las otra integrantes son:
Juana –quien se dedica a la venta de carne por mayoreo y menudeo.
Margarita-se dedica a la venta de pollos frescos.
Le dan las gracias a fundación   por ayudar a las personas  trabajadoras que desean superarse a pesar de su edad y de  ser de pueblos pequeños .
texts.en:
This group is called Las Gaviotas de Soto and is made up of three people: one man and two women, who are humble, hard-working, and kind.

The representative of the group is Félix, who is seventy-nine years old.  He has worked for three years selling and raising cattle.  He is happily married to Gloria, a hard-working woman.  Félix tells us that to feed his cattle, he leaves very early with his water jug and his tortillas for lunch and he eats since he returns home at about six in the evening.  He then leaves with his herd to graze and give them water and the following day he has to milk them, so that Gloria can make her delicious cheeses.  He requests the loan to purchase more cattle and feed for his cows, since he needs to feed them well so that when it is time to sell them, they weigh a lot and look very healthy.  

The other members are: Juana, who works selling meat wholesale and retail, and Margarita, who works selling fresh chicken.  They are thankful to the foundation for helping hard-working people who want to better themselves, despite their age and being from small towns.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío rural de nombre “Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 74” caserío perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande el mismo que pertenece a la provincia de Piura. La zona en la que vive es una zona rural en donde sus habitantes normalmente se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería exclusivamente. Por ahora su caserío solo cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Fany se dedica a la crianza y posterior venta de animales como porcino, ovinos y en su gran mayoría aves de corral, pues ya ha generado una clientela que la solicita cada vez que necesitan de sus servicios, ella recorre caserío en caserío realizando compras de animales criarlos, engordarlos y después venderlos al mejor precio. Su esposo se ha dedicado siempre al trabajo de la agricultura para lo que trabaja como jornalero en diferentes fundos de su caserío con lo que ayuda a Fany al sustento de hogar.

Fany ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los mismo que empleara para la compra de alimentos balanceados para aumentar el peso de sus animales los cuales están por ser vendidos.

Se le conoce por su responsabilidad y dedicación al trabajo pues ya anteriormente ha sido cliente de esta institución pagando de manera puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Fany is 39 years old, is married, and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in a home of her own in the rural settlement called “Las Mónicas Mz A Lote 74,” which is part of the Tambogrande district and the Piura province.  The zone where she lives is a rural one where the residents usually exclusively farm and raise livestock.  For now, electricity is the only service in the settlement.

Fany raises and sells animals such as pigs, cattle, and mostly poultry, and has established a large number of customers who seek her out whenever they need her services.  She travels from settlement to settlement buying animals, raises them, fattens them up, and then selling them for a profit.  Her husband has always been a farmer and works daily at different farms within the settlement.  In this way he helps Fany support their home.

Fany has requested an amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa and will use the money to buy balanced feed to increase the weight of the animals she will sell.
 
She is known for being responsible and for her dedication to her work.  She has been a client of this institution in the past and has always made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Benigno

texts.en:
Benigno is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco.  Benigno is 51 years old and married with three children between the ages of 16 and 28. For many years, he has worked as a plumber, largely on contract for construction projects. He is now looking to invest his skills in a construction project of a more personal nature: improving his house.

Benigno is requesting a loan in order to purchase home improvement materials such as paint, concrete, and plaster. He looks forward to improving the physical structure and beautifying the exterior, including a new layer of gray paint. Benigno has lived in his house for 12 years and hopes that the loan will enable him to provide a more comfortable home for his family.

loans.use: purchase home improvement materials

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Judith is 30 years old. She lives with a partner and is raising two children, a 2.5-year-old son and a 9-year-old daughter. Judith has worked as a refrigerator technician for eight years and shares a work space with her parents, who run a separate business. Additionally, Judith runs a business selling hardware on Saturdays.

Judith is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as pliers, hammers, and kitchen spare parts for her hardware supply shop. Her business is still small but she hopes to grow it as much as possible and one day own a large and successful shop.

loans.use: buy hardware merchandise

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. David is 31 years old and single. He owns and operates a metal workshop with his brother. From the age of 15, David has worked in the shop constructing all types of metal structures for his customers, including verandas, stairs, handrails, windows, furniture, and doors.

David is requesting a loan in order to purchase metal working materials such as machinery, tools, and sheet metal. Using the returns from his investments, David dreams that one day he will be able to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: buy metal working materials, machinery and tools

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina is one of 12 members of the village bank “Luz del Sur”, located in the Andean highlands of Cusco. Antonia is 54 years old and, with her partner, is raising four children between the ages of 14 and 25. For the past three years, Antonia has been working as a housemaid in order to support her family. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase home improvement materials such as plaster, paint, and cement to renovate her house.  Antonia has been living in her house for two years and hopes to provide a more comfortable environment for her family. She dreams of seeing her children complete their education and attain professional degrees.

loans.use: buy materials to improve her house

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Margarita makes her home in a simple structure with her husband. They live in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Margarita is a member of the group Fe y Accion 1 (Faith and Action). This group, like many others, runs its businesses by walking through the community and selling from home. Most of them are selling clothes, shoes and jewelry, while others run beauty salons, grocery stores, etc.

Margarita operates a Fantasia, a small business where she sells miscellaneous products. She has been in business for over five years, starting with some savings she had. While she says that her most important challenge is developing her business, she continues to enjoy it.

She is excited to be taking a group loan of 117,000 DOP, her seventh, with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use her portion of this loan to invest in cosmetics, shoes, women accessories, underwear, clothes, etc. to sell. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

Margarita is very happy for your support, and she wants to thank you in her group’s name and her own!!!

loans.use: to buy products to sell from her Fantasia.

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Rum, 38, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). 

She has been selling fish at the market for over two years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately USD 4 per day. Her son is also a construction worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling, Rum is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell at the market. 

In the future, she would like to run a laundry at home to generate extra income for the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for carrying fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel es un joven estudiante de la carrera de Relaciones Internacionales y Comercio Exterior, está en el último año, y está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios. Miguel es un joven trabajador y con sus ingresos pagará el préstamo. Sus sueños son trabajar en la cancillería de la república o estar en un consulado fuera de Nicaragua. Le inspira el poder ayudar su país y a las personas necesitadas y sobre todo le inspira su mamá que siempre le ha apoyado.
texts.en: Miguel is a young student studying International Relations and External Commerce. He is in his last year and he is requesting a loan to pay for his final classes. Miguel is a hardworking young man and with his income, he will pay the loan. His dreams are to work in the republic’s state department or to work in a consulate outside of Nicaragua. He is inspired to be able to help his country and people in need, and above all, he is inspired by his mother, who has always supported him.

loans.use: to pay for his final classes for graduation

loans.name: Kenia Valeska

texts.es: Kenia está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de finalización de estudios y así poder obtener su título de Licenciatura en Química y Farmacia. Actualmente trabaja como auxliar contable. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener éxito en su carrera, poder desempeñarse en el carrera que estudió, y así poder ayudar a sus padres, y asegurar un buen futuro para su familia. Creció en una familia trabajadora que todos los días lucha por salir adelante. Espera poder trabajar como regente de farmacia o visitadora médica.
texts.en: Kenia is requesting the loan to pay for her final classes so that she can graduate with her bachelor’s degree in Chemistry and Pharmacy. She is currently working as an assistant accountant. Her greatest dream in life is be successful in her studies, to be able to work in the career she studied for, and to be able to help her parents and assure a good future for her family. She grew up in a hardworking family that works hard every day to get ahead. She hopes to work as a pharmacist or a pharmaceutical sales representative.

loans.use: to pay for her final classes for graduation

loans.name: Marjorie Leslania

texts.es: Marjorie está solicitando el crédito para pagar el curso de tiutlación de la carrera que está estudiando, Química y Farmacia, una carrera con duarción de 4 años. Dentro de 5 años se ve con una farmacia propia, grande, surtida y dando buena atención a sus clientes, con descuentos y atención médica. Ella también es una pequeña comerciante de venta de productos cosméticos por catálogos, y de esa forma está pagando sus estudios.
texts.en: Marjorie is requesting a loan to pay for her final classes so she can graduate with the degree she is studying for, Chemistry and Pharmacy, a degree that takes 4 years. Within five years she sees herself owning a pharmacy that is large, well-stocked, that provides good service to its clients, with discounts and medical attention. She is also a small businesswoman and sells cosmetic products from catalogs; this is how she pays for her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her final classes for graduation

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es: Rosa de 33 años de edad tiene 3 niños, el mayor estudiando la primaria y los 2 menores que son gemelitos en preescolar, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Rosa Aura labora como docente desde hace mas de 11 años. Esta solicitando su credito con el objetivo de instalar los servicios basicos (agua potable y luz eléctrica) en su propia casa, pues anteriormente estaba alquilando.  Cabe mencionar que con sus creditos anteriores logro comprar un solar y posteriormente levantar aunque sea de madera su casita.
texts.en: 33-year-old Rosa has three children.  Her eldest is in elementary school and her two youngest (twins) are in pre-school.  Her life partner works as a builder and supports her with their household expenses.  Rosa Aura has been working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Fuente de Vida High School for more than 11 years.  She is requesting her 11th loan to install basic services (drinking water and electricity) in her home as she previously rented.  We should mention that she used her previous loans to buy a plot of land and then build her small house, albeit from wood.

loans.use: to install basic services of water and electricity

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
El socio se siegue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carroq ue hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es mejorar su carro que hace servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar llantas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues his transportation business.  He has a car which he uses to provide taxi services and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  He wants to get ahead through this business.  His dream is to fix up his taxi and he is requesting a loan to buy new tires.

He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nieve is the coordinator of the group "Mata de Palma en Desarrollo" group 1 & 2, (Palm tree in development) named like this because this is the community where the group is located in Hato Mayor city, in the eastern part of the country. The group includes 10 micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Nieve's family includes herself, her long-term partner and her eight children. Nieve is very excited to receive her 13th loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly repaid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about eight years. She started it when she took her first loan.

 Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products, but she will use this loan to buy medicine and veterinary instruments.  She is a veterinarian. She will use her business profits to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy medicine and veterinary instruments

loans.name: Tuwezeshane Group

texts.en:
Salum, who is in his early 40s, is married and has three children, one of whom goes to school and the other two are still too young.  He has been running a food shop for five years now.  He works from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salum's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to restock the missing items in his food shop and pay school fees.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants another loan to re-stock his shop with items like rice, sugar, beans and wheat flour.  His dream is to one day become an international business man.

Salum will share this loan with his loan group "Tuwezeshane", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Vencia

texts.en:
Vencia, 56, lives in Dolipos Bajo, a neighborhood of Oroquieta City in Misamis Province. She is married with two children.

Vencia sells barbecue to eat and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and is now requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC to buy more ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Chaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Chaka est âgé de 48 ans marié à deux épouses et est père de 5 enfants. Il vit dans la ville de Koutiala  avec sa famille. 
Son enfance a été perturbée par des problèmes familiaux qui lui ait empêché  d’étudier. Pour pouvoir réussir dans la vie,  il  n’a pas  pris du temps à embrasser les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il décide de faire  la vente des poissons, séchés, fumés, qu’il appris auprès de ses amis il y a 22 ans. 
Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 ans. Il est à son 2eme prêt individuel après avoir remboursé le premier.
